One-Pan Weeknight Sausage and Peppers Recipe | Bon Appetit




















































Close Menu IconLoginRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastSubscribe to our newsletterSign UpPrivacy and user agreementMain Navigation IconBA LogoBon appetitLoginSPONSOREDOne-Pan Weeknight Sausage and PeppersSponsored by Field Roast FacebookPinterestTwitterEmailPhoto by: LAURA MURRAYServing Size: 4 PeopleBon Appétit has teamed up with Field Roast, the makers of artisanal plant-based meats and cheeses, to explore the great tastes of the holiday season. Readers submitted their original Field Roast holiday recipe's for the chance to be featured in this December’s Bon Appétit magazine! Our winning recipe, submitted by Nadine Lockitch, is a must-have at the end of a winter day. This hearty one-pan recipe featuring Field Roast Plant-Based Italian Sausage, vegetables, and spices, packs bold flavor. It's guaranteed to become a weeknight mainstay. 
Find more recipe inspiration from Bon Appétit and Field Roast's Gather What's Good recipe series.PrintIngredients1 12.05-oz. package Field Roast Plant-Based Italian Sausage, sliced into ¼" rounds¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil1 yellow onion, chopped3 cups chopped multicolor bell peppers4 garlic cloves, minced½ tsp red pepper flakes, plus more for serving1 14-oz. can crushed tomatoesCooked spaghettiKosher salt and freshly ground black pepperRecipe PreparationIn large skillet, heat 2 Tbsp olive oil over medium-high. Add onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until light golden, 5 minutes. Add bell peppers. Cook stirring occasionally until tender, 5 minutes. Add garlic, fennel seeds and red pepper flakes; cook, stirring occasionally until fragrant, 30 seconds. Salt and pepper to taste.Push vegetables to edges of skillet. Add remaining 2 Tbsp olive oil and Field Roast Plant-Based Italian Sausage in center of skillet. Cook until golden, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir to combine.Add crushed tomatoes. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 5 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.
